newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Subic seeks more time to re-evaluate port bids.
newsitem.headline: Subic seeks more time to re-evaluate port bids.

text.p: The Philippines' Subic Bay Metropolitan Administration (SBMA) was given a few more days to further review bids for a multi-million peso contract to operate a port in the freeport area, President Fidel Ramos said on Wednesday.
"SBMA has asked us for a few days (of) extension so that they can continue their reevaluaton of the bids ... We have granted them that extension," Ramos said in a televised news conference.
SBMA last month awarded the contract to the second highest bidder, the Philippine unit of Hong Kong's Hutchison Whampoa Ltd.

The SBMA said the highest bidder, International Container Terminal Services Inc (ICTSI), violated an existing department order banning port operators from holding interests of over 20 percent in more than one international port in the country.
However, ICTSI said the SBMA, being an autonomous agency is not under the Department of Transportation and Communications.
President Ramos had asked the SBMA to review its decision and revaluate all the submitted bids. The agency was supposed to give its decision on September 19.
